channel.title: OSINT websites for passive recon
channel.description:
Hi all, recently I have come across a couple of Open-Source Intel websites that I have come to find quite useful. I do not know how old or common they are but I have just recently found them;
[https://www.punkspider.org](https://www.punkspider.org) - is a web application vulnerability search engine that scans for seven of the biggest web app vulnerabilities and puts the results into a search-able archive.
[https://www.censys.io](https://www.censys.io) - is basically the same as shodan but a little more technical.
And in case there are any new newbies who do not already know, [www.shodan.io](http://www.shodan.io) is a great website to find new targets and perform passive recon. - If anyone else has any other goodies please follow up, thanks -n0SiS

item.title: OSINT websites for passive recon
item.dc:creator: n0SiS
item.description:
Hi all, recently I have come across a couple of Open-Source Intel websites that I have come to find quite useful. I do not know how old or common they are but I have just recently found them;

https://www.punkspider.org - is a web application vulnerability search engine that scans for seven of the biggest web app vulnerabilities and puts the results into a search-able archive.

https://www.censys.io - is basically the same as shodan but a little more technical.

And in case there are any new newbies who do not already know, www.shodan.io is a great website to find new targets and perform passive recon.

  • If anyone else has any other goodies please follow up, thanks
    -n0SiS
